◆ NoMusicPlease()

bool Pcm::NoMusicPlease ( )

См. определение в файле music.cpp строка 75

76 {
77  #if NO_MUSIC_PLEASE
78  return true;
79  #else
80  // Cannot have music if building for proview, because there is not enough IOP memory
81  // (ProView uses up some IOP memory with it's monitor)
82  if (Config::GetHardware()==Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW)
83  {
84  return true;
85  }
86 
87  return !music_hed_there;
88  #endif
89 }

Перекрестные ссылки Config::GetHardware(), Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW и music_hed_there.

Используется в _PlayMusicStream(), _PlayMusicTrack(), _PreLoadMusicStream(), AddTrackToPlaylist(), ClearPlaylist(), GetNumTracks(), GetTrackForbiddenStatus(), GetTrackName(), Init(), LoadMusicHeader(), PauseMusic(), PlayMusicStream(), PlayTrack(), PreLoadMusicStream(), PreLoadMusicStreamDone(), RandomTrackUpdate(), SetActiveTrackList(), SetMusicStreamVolume(), SetRandomMode(), SetTrackForbiddenStatus(), SetVolume(), SkipMusicTrack(), StartPreLoadedMusicStream(), StopMusic(), TrackIsPlaying(), TrackUpdate() и Update().

◆ TrackIsPlaying()

bool Pcm::TrackIsPlaying ( int  whichList,
int  whichTrack 
)

См. определение в файле music.cpp строка 2081

2082 {
2083 
2084  if (NoMusicPlease()) return false;
2085 
2086  Dbg_MsgAssert( gPcmInitialized,( "Calling Pcm func when PCM Audio not initialized." ));
2087  int pcmStatus = PCMAudio_GetMusicStatus( );
2088  if ( pcmStatus == PCM_STATUS_FREE )
2089  return ( false );
2090  if ( whichTrack >= gTrackLists[ whichList ].numTracks )
2091  return ( false );
2092  // can't do a strcmp, because files in gTrackName have been converted to all uppercase...
2093  if ( Script::GenerateCRC( gTrackName ) == Script::GenerateCRC( gTrackLists[ whichList ].trackInfo[ whichTrack ].trackName ) )
2094  return ( true );
2095  return ( false );
2096 }

Перекрестные ссылки Script::GenerateCRC(), gPcmInitialized, gTrackLists, gTrackName, NoMusicPlease(), PCM_STATUS_FREE и PCMAudio_GetMusicStatus().

Используется в SetTrackForbiddenStatus().

◆ GetChannelFromID()

int Pcm::GetChannelFromID ( uint32  id,
bool  assert_if_duplicate = true 
)

См. определение в файле music.cpp строка 172

173 {
174  int i;
175 
176  for ( i = 0; i < NUM_STREAMS; i++ )
177  {
178  if ( (gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].uniqueID == id) && (PCMAudio_GetStreamStatus(gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].voice) != PCM_STATUS_FREE))
179  {
180  return i;
181  }
182  }
183 
184  for ( i = 0; i < NUM_STREAMS; i++ )
185  {
186  if ( (gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].controlID == id) && (PCMAudio_GetStreamStatus(gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].voice) != PCM_STATUS_FREE))
187  {
188  Dbg_MsgAssert(!assert_if_duplicate, ("Trying to control duplicate stream %s by checksum", Script::FindChecksumName(id)));
189  return i;
190  }
191  }
192 
193  return -1;
194 }

Перекрестные ссылки Script::FindChecksumName(), gCurrentStreamInfo, PCM_STATUS_FREE и PCMAudio_GetStreamStatus().

Используется в PreLoadStreamDone(), SetStreamPitchFromID(), SetStreamVolumeFromID(), StartPreLoadedStream(), StopStreamFromID(), StreamLoading() и StreamPlaying().

◆ StopMusic()

void Pcm::StopMusic ( void  )

См. определение в файле music.cpp строка 205

206 {
207  if (NoMusicPlease()) return;
208 
209  // the counter has to reach SONG_UPDATE_INTERVAL before a new song is played...
210  // so resetting the counter keeps a new song from playing right away.
211  sCounter = 1;
212  gMusicStreamType = MUSIC_STREAM_TYPE_NONE; // In case we were in this mode
213  PCMAudio_StopMusic( true );
214 }

◆ sGenerateRandomSongOrder()

static void Pcm::sGenerateRandomSongOrder ( void  )
static

См. определение в файле music.cpp строка 320

321 {
322  int num_songs=Pcm::GetSoundtrackNumSongs( s_xbox_user_soundtrack );
323 
324  if( num_songs == 0 )
325  {
326  // Nothing to do.
327  return;
328  }
329 
330  // Limit to MAX_USER_SONGS to prevent any buffer overwriting.
331  if (num_songs>MAX_USER_SONGS)
332  {
333  num_songs=MAX_USER_SONGS;
334  }
335 
336  // Remember the last song in the previous order, so we can make sure that
337  // the first song in the new order is different from it.
338  // Note: OK if the last song was just an uninitialised random value, won't cause any problems.
339  int last_song=sp_xbox_randomized_songs[num_songs-1];
340 
341  // Initialise the order to be 0,1,2,3 ... etc
342  for (int i=0; i<num_songs; ++i)
343  {
344  sp_xbox_randomized_songs[i]=i;
345  }
346 
347  // Jumble it up.
348  for (int n=0; n<2000; ++n)
349  {
350  int a=Mth::Rnd(num_songs);
351  int b=Mth::Rnd(num_songs);
352 
353  int temp=sp_xbox_randomized_songs[a];
354  sp_xbox_randomized_songs[a]=sp_xbox_randomized_songs[b];
355  sp_xbox_randomized_songs[b]=temp;
356  }
357 
358  // If the first song in the new order equals the last song of the last order,
359  // do one further swap to make sure it is different.
360  if (sp_xbox_randomized_songs[0]==last_song)
361  {
362  // a is the first song.
363  int a=0;
364 
365  // Choose b to be a random one of the other songs.
366  int b;
367  if (num_songs>1)
368  {
369  // Make b not able to equal 0, so that we don't swap the first with itself.
370  b=1+Mth::Rnd(num_songs-1);
371  }
372  else
373  {
374  // Unless there is only one song, in which case just swap it with itself. No point but what the heck.
375  b=0;
376  }
377 
378  // Do the swap.
379  int temp=sp_xbox_randomized_songs[a];
380  sp_xbox_randomized_songs[a]=sp_xbox_randomized_songs[b];
381  sp_xbox_randomized_songs[b]=temp;
382  }
383 }

Перекрестные ссылки GetSoundtrackNumSongs(), Mth::Rnd(), s_xbox_user_soundtrack и sp_xbox_randomized_songs.

Используется в _PlayMusicTrack(), SetRandomMode() и UseUserSoundtrack().

◆ _PlayStream()

int Pcm::_PlayStream ( uint32  checksum,
Sfx::sVolume *  p_volume,
float  pitch,
int  priority,
uint32  controlID,
bool  preload_only 
)

См. определение в файле music.cpp строка 617

618 {
619  if (StreamsDisabled()) return -1;
620 
621 # ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
622  Dbg_MsgAssert( gPcmInitialized,( "Calling _PlayStream(), when PCM Audio not initialized." ));
623 # endif // __PLAT_XBOX__
624 
625  // Initialize lowest to a valid entry
626  int lowest_priority = gCurrentStreamInfo[ 0 ].priority;
627  int lowest_priority_channel = 0;
628  uint32 lowest_priority_start_frame = gCurrentStreamInfo[ 0 ].start_frame;
629 
630  bool success;
631 
632  for ( int i = 0; i < NUM_STREAMS; i++ )
633  {
634  if ( PCMAudio_GetStreamStatus( i ) == PCM_STATUS_FREE )
635  {
636  if (preload_only)
637  {
638  success = PCMAudio_PreLoadStream( checksum, i );
639  }
640  else
641  {
642 // success = PCMAudio_PlayStream( checksum, i, volumeL, volumeR, pitch );
643 # ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
644  success = PCMAudio_PlayStream( checksum, i, p_volume, pitch );
645 # else
646  success = PCMAudio_PlayStream( checksum, i, p_volume->GetChannelVolume( 0 ), p_volume->GetChannelVolume( 1 ), pitch );
647 # endif
648  }
649 
650  if ( !success )
651  {
652  return ( -1 );
653  }
654 
655  gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].controlID = controlID;
656  gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].uniqueID = GenerateUniqueID(controlID);
657  gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].voice = i;
658  gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].priority = priority;
659  gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].start_frame = (uint32)Tmr::GetRenderFrame();
660  gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].p_frame_amp = CStreamFrameAmpManager::sGetFrameAmp(checksum);
661  return ( i );
662  }
663  else if ( gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].priority <= lowest_priority )
664  {
665  // If it is equal priority, we want to find the oldest one
666  if ((gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].priority == lowest_priority) &&
667  (gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].start_frame >= lowest_priority_start_frame))
668  {
669  continue;
670  }
671 
672  lowest_priority = gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].priority;
673  lowest_priority_channel = i;
674  lowest_priority_start_frame = gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].start_frame;
675  }
676  }
677 
678  // Couldn't find a free one, so lets see if we can knock one off
679  if (priority >= lowest_priority)
680  {
681  PCMAudio_StopStream( lowest_priority_channel );
682 
683  #if WAIT_AFTER_STOP_STREAM
684  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Priority streams not implemented on this system")); // Not implemented
685  return ( -1 );
686  #else
687  if (preload_only)
688  {
689  success = PCMAudio_PreLoadStream( checksum, lowest_priority_channel );
690  }
691  else
692  {
693 // success = PCMAudio_PlayStream( checksum, lowest_priority_channel, volumeL, volumeR, pitch );
694 # ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
695  success = PCMAudio_PlayStream( checksum, lowest_priority_channel, p_volume, pitch );
696 # else
697  success = PCMAudio_PlayStream( checksum, lowest_priority_channel, p_volume->GetChannelVolume( 0 ), p_volume->GetChannelVolume( 1 ), pitch );
698 # endif
699  }
700 
701  if ( !success )
702  {
703  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Higher priority stream could not start. Make sure there was another error (like file not found)."));
704  return ( -1 );
705  }
706 
707  gCurrentStreamInfo[ lowest_priority_channel ].controlID = controlID;
708  gCurrentStreamInfo[ lowest_priority_channel ].uniqueID = GenerateUniqueID(controlID);
709  gCurrentStreamInfo[ lowest_priority_channel ].voice = lowest_priority_channel;
710  gCurrentStreamInfo[ lowest_priority_channel ].priority = priority;
711  gCurrentStreamInfo[ lowest_priority_channel ].start_frame = (uint32)Tmr::GetRenderFrame();
712  gCurrentStreamInfo[ lowest_priority_channel ].p_frame_amp = CStreamFrameAmpManager::sGetFrameAmp(checksum);
713  #endif // WAIT_AFTER_STOP_STREAM
714  return ( lowest_priority_channel );
715  }
716 
717  return ( -1 );
718 }

801 
802  // Seems strange to cancel out a stream if it starting low
803  if( fabsf( vol.GetLoudestChannel()) < MIN_STREAM_VOL )
804  {
805  if( Script::GetInteger( 0xd7bb618d /* DebugSoundFx */, Script::NO_ASSERT ))
806  {
807  Dbg_Message("I wanted to cancel stream %s", Script::FindChecksumName(streamNameChecksum));
808  }
809 // return 0;
810  }
811  }
812  else
813  {
814  vol.SetChannelVolume( 0, volume );
815  vol.SetChannelVolume( 1, volume );
816  }
817 
818  // K: The 'false' on the end means do not record the call in the replay, because this
819  // call to PlayStreamFromObject has already been recorded.
820  uint32 uniqueID = PlayStream( streamNameChecksum, &vol, pitch, priority, controlID, false );
821  if ( uniqueID )
822  {
823  Dbg_MsgAssert( ( ( gLastStreamChannelPlayed >= 0 ) && ( gLastStreamChannelPlayed < MAX_STREAMS_PER_OBJECT ) ), ( "Tell Matt to fix object streams" ) );
824  if ( gpStreamingObj[ gLastStreamChannelPlayed ] )
825  {
826  // the object might not have called StreamUpdate yet, so the slot might
827  // still think it's in use... clear the slot if that's the case:
828  gpStreamingObj[ gLastStreamChannelPlayed ]->mStreamingID[ gLastStreamChannelPlayed ] = 0;
829  gpStreamingObj[ gLastStreamChannelPlayed ] = NULL;
830  }
831 // Dbg_MsgAssert( !gpStreamingObj[ gLastStreamChannelPlayed ], ( "Have Matt fix object streams... Kick him in the nutsack while you're at it." ) );
832 // Dbg_MsgAssert( !pObject->mStreamingID[ gLastStreamChannelPlayed ], ( "Have Matt fix object streams... Hell, fire matt!!!" ) );
833  gpStreamingObj[ gLastStreamChannelPlayed ] = pComponent;
834  pComponent->mStreamingID[ gLastStreamChannelPlayed ] = uniqueID;
835  // if volume modifier sent in, store that:
836  if ( volume != 100.0f )
837  {
838  int i;
839  for ( i = 0; i < NUM_STREAMS; i++ )
840  {
841  if ( gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].uniqueID == uniqueID )
842  {
843  gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].volume = PERCENT( gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].volume, volume );
844  gCurrentStreamInfo[ i ].dropoff = dropoff;
845  }
846  }
847  }
848 
849  // store state of use_pos_info
850  if ( !use_pos_info )
851  {
852  for ( int i = 0; i < NUM_STREAMS; i++ )
853  {
854  if ( gCurrentStreamInfo[i].uniqueID == uniqueID )
855  {
856  gCurrentStreamInfo[i].use_pos_info = false;
857  }
858  }
859  }
860  else
861  {
862  for ( int i = 0; i < NUM_STREAMS; i++ )
863  {
864  if ( gCurrentStreamInfo[i].uniqueID == uniqueID )
865  {
866  gCurrentStreamInfo[i].use_pos_info = true;
867  gCurrentStreamInfo[i].dropoffFunction = dropoffFunc;
868  }
869  }
870  }
871  }
872  return ( uniqueID );
873 }

◆ PauseMusic()

void Pcm::PauseMusic ( int  pause)

См. определение в файле music.cpp строка 1300

1301 {
1302 
1303 
1304  static bool wasPaused = false;
1305 
1306  if (NoMusicPlease()) return;
1307 
1308  Dbg_MsgAssert( gPcmInitialized,( "Calling Pcm::Pause when PCM Audio not initialized." ));
1309  switch ( pause )
1310  {
1311  case ( -1 ):
1312  // special case... unpause only if it was unpaused last time pause was called...

1324  break;
1325  case ( 0 ):

◆ RandomTrackUpdate()

void Pcm::RandomTrackUpdate ( void  )

См. определение в файле music.cpp строка 1622

1623 {
1624 
1625  TrackList *pTrackList = &gTrackLists[ gCurrentTrackList ];
1626 
1627  if (NoMusicPlease()) return;
1628 
1629 
1630  if ( pTrackList->allTracksForbidden )
1631  {
1632 // Dbg_Message( "all tracks forbidden.. random mode" );
1633  return;
1634  }

1636  if ( pcmStatus == PCM_STATUS_FREE )
1637  {
1638  #if WAIT_AFTER_STOP_STREAM
1639  // If we were waiting for StopMusic() to finish, we need to start the music stream
1640  if (gMusicStreamWaitingToStart)
1641  {
1642  _StartMusicStream();
1643  return;
1644  }
1645  #endif // WAIT_AFTER_STOP_STREAM
1646

1648  sSetCorrectMusicVolume();
1649 
1650  // Replay track if looping
1651  if (gMusicLooping)
1652  {
1653  PlayTrack( gTrackName, true );
1654  return;
1655  }
1656

1663  if ( shuffle_random_songs )
1664  {
1665  // Remember the last song in the previous order, so we can make sure that
1666  // the first song in the new order is different from it.
1667  // Note: OK if the last song was just an uninitialised random value, won't cause any problems.
1668  int last_song=sp_random_song_order[num_random_songs-1];
1669 
1670  // count active tracks
1671  num_random_songs=0;
1672  for (int i=0; i<pTrackList->numTracks; ++i)
1673  {
1674  if ( i < 64)
1675  {
1676  if ( !( pTrackList->trackForbidden0 & ( ((uint64)1) << i ) ) )
1677  {
1678  // Intialize order
1679  sp_random_song_order[num_random_songs]=i;
1680  // add one
1681  num_random_songs++;
1682  }
1683  }
1684  else
1685  {
1686  if ( !( pTrackList->trackForbidden1 & ( ((uint64)1) << (i-64) ) ) )
1687  {
1688  // Intialize order
1689  sp_random_song_order[num_random_songs]=i;
1690  // add one
1691  num_random_songs++;
1692  }
1693  }
1694  }
1695 
1696  // need to shuffle order
1697  printf("shuffling random song order num_songs=%i\n", num_random_songs );
1698 
1699  // Jumble it up.
1700  for (int n=0; n<2000; ++n)
1701  {
1702  int a=Mth::Rnd(num_random_songs);
1703  int b=Mth::Rnd(num_random_songs);
1704 
1705  if ( a != b )
1706  {
1707  int temp=sp_random_song_order[a];
1708  sp_random_song_order[a]=sp_random_song_order[b];
1709  sp_random_song_order[b]=temp;
1710  }
1711  }
1712 
1713  // If the first song in the new order equals the last song of the last order,
1714  // do one further swap to make sure it is different.
1715  if (sp_random_song_order[0]==last_song)
1716  {
1717  // a is the first song.
1718  int a=0;
1719 
1720  // Choose b to be a random one of the other songs.
1721  int b;
1722  if (num_random_songs>1)
1723  {
1724  // Make b not able to equal 0, so that we don't swap the first with itself.
1725  b=1+Mth::Rnd(num_random_songs-1);
1726  }
1727  else
1728  {
1729  // Unless there is only one song, in which case just swap it with itself. No point but what the heck.
1730  b=0;
1731  }
1732 
1733  // Do the swap.
1734  int temp=sp_random_song_order[a];
1735  sp_random_song_order[a]=sp_random_song_order[b];
1736  sp_random_song_order[b]=temp;
1737  }
1738 
1739  // reset index
1740  random_song_index=0;
1741  shuffle_random_songs=false;
1742  pTrackList->trackPlayed0 = 0;
1743  pTrackList->trackPlayed1 = 0;
1744  }
1745  else
1746  {
1747  random_song_index++;
1748  if ( random_song_index >= (num_random_songs-1) )
1749  {
1750  shuffle_random_songs=true;
1751  }
1752  }
1753 
1754  for ( int i = 0; i < pTrackList->numTracks; i++ )
1755  {
1756  int t = ( sp_random_song_order[random_song_index] );
1757  //printf("index = %i song = %i\n", random_song_index, sp_random_song_order[random_song_index] );
1758 
1759  if ( ( !( pTrackList->trackForbidden0 & ( ((uint64)1) << t ) ) && ( t < 64 ) &&
1760  !( pTrackList->trackPlayed0 & ( ((uint64)1) << t ) ) ) )
1761  {
1762  pTrackList->trackPlayed0 |= ( ((uint64)1) << t );
1763  PlayTrack( pTrackList->trackInfo[ t ].trackName );
1764  current_music_track=t;
1765  Dbg_Message( "Playing track %s %i %i", pTrackList->trackInfo[ t ].trackName, t, current_music_track );
1766 
1767  // update track text on screen
1768  Script::CStruct *pParams = new Script::CStruct;
1769  pParams->AddInteger(CRCD(0x8d02705d,"current_track"),current_music_track);
1770  Script::RunScript( "spawn_update_music_track_text", pParams );
1771  delete pParams;
1772 
1773  return;
1774  }
1775 
1776  if ( ( !( pTrackList->trackForbidden1 & ( ((uint64)1) << (t-64) ) ) && ( t >= 64 ) &&
1777  !( pTrackList->trackPlayed1 & ( ((uint64)1) << (t-64) ) ) )
1778  )
1779  {
1780  pTrackList->trackPlayed1 |= ( ((uint64)1) << (t-64) );
1781  PlayTrack( pTrackList->trackInfo[ t ].trackName );
1782  current_music_track=t;
1783  Dbg_Message( "Playing track %s %i %i", pTrackList->trackInfo[ t ].trackName, t, current_music_track );
1784 
1785  // update track text on screen
1786  Script::CStruct *pParams = new Script::CStruct;
1787  pParams->AddInteger(CRCD(0x8d02705d,"current_track"),current_music_track);
1788  Script::RunScript( "spawn_update_music_track_text", pParams );
1789  delete pParams;
1790 
1791  return;
1792  }
1793  }
1794  }
1795 }

1805  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1806  if ( skate_mod->GetGameMode( )->IsFrontEnd( ) )
1807  {
1808  trackList = TRACKLIST_LEVEL_SPECIFIC;
1809  }
1810 
1811  TrackList *pTrackList = &gTrackLists[ trackList ];
1812 
1813  if ( pTrackList->allTracksForbidden )
1814  {
1815 // Dbg_Message( "all tracks forbidden.. sequential mode" );
1816  return;
1817  }
1818  int pcmStatus = PCMAudio_GetMusicStatus( );
1819  if ( pcmStatus == PCM_STATUS_FREE )
1820  {
1821  #if WAIT_AFTER_STOP_STREAM
1822  // If we were waiting for StopMusic() to finish, we need to start the music stream
1823  if (gMusicStreamWaitingToStart)
1824  {
1825  _StartMusicStream();
1826  return;
1827  }
1828  #endif // WAIT_AFTER_STOP_STREAM
1829 
1830  gMusicStreamType = MUSIC_STREAM_TYPE_NONE; // Just in case we were playing a music stream
1831  sSetCorrectMusicVolume();
1832 
1833  // Replay track if looping
1834  if (gMusicLooping)
1835  {
1836  PlayTrack( gTrackName, true );
1837  return;
1838  }
1839 
1840  // don't have a random function. just play next track...
1841  int i;
1842  for ( i = 0; i < pTrackList->numTracks; i++ )
1843  {
1844  if ( ( !( pTrackList->trackForbidden0 & ( ((uint64)1) << i ) ) && ( i < 64 ) &&
1845  !( pTrackList->trackPlayed0 & ( ((uint64)1) << i ) ) ) )
1846  {
1847  pTrackList->trackPlayed0 |= ( ((uint64)1) << i );
1848  PlayTrack( pTrackList->trackInfo[ i ].trackName );
1849  current_music_track=i;
1850  Dbg_Message( "Playing track %s %i %i", pTrackList->trackInfo[ i ].trackName, i, current_music_track );
1851 
1852  // update track text on screen
1853  Script::CStruct *pParams = new Script::CStruct;
1854  pParams->AddInteger(CRCD(0x8d02705d,"current_track"),current_music_track);
1855  Script::RunScript( "spawn_update_music_track_text", pParams );
1856  delete pParams;
1857 
1858  return;
1859  }
1860 
1861  if ( ( !( pTrackList->trackForbidden1 & ( ((uint64)1) << (i-64) ) ) && ( i >= 64 ) &&
1862  !( pTrackList->trackPlayed1 & ( ((uint64)1) << (i-64) ) ) ) )
1863  {
1864  pTrackList->trackPlayed1 |= ( ((uint64)1) << (i-64) );
1865  PlayTrack( pTrackList->trackInfo[ i ].trackName );
1866  current_music_track=i;
1867  Dbg_Message( "Playing track %s %i %i", pTrackList->trackInfo[ i ].trackName, i, current_music_track );
1868 
1869  // update track text on screen
1870  Script::CStruct *pParams = new Script::CStruct;
1871  pParams->AddInteger(CRCD(0x8d02705d,"current_track"),current_music_track);
1872  Script::RunScript( "spawn_update_music_track_text", pParams );
1873  delete pParams;
1874 
1875  return;
1876  }
1877  }
1878  // all the tracks have been played... reset:
1879  pTrackList->trackPlayed0 = 0;
1880  pTrackList->trackPlayed1 = 0;
1881  }
1882 }

202  ( length == last_length[lp] ) &&
203  ( offset == last_offset[lp] ) )
204  {
205  repeat_read = true;
206  break;
207  }
208  }
209 
210  if ( repeat_read )
211  {
212  // Find an empty slot for this callback.
213  int cb = -1;
214  for ( int lp = 0; lp < 8; lp++ )
215  {
216  if ( last_callback_counter[lp] == -1 )
217  {
218  cb = lp;
219  break;
220  }
221  }
222 
223  if ( cb == -1 )
224  {
225 # ifdef __NOPT_FINAL__
226  OSReport( "Warning: Overflowed DVD callback buffer\n" );
227 # else
228  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Overflowed DVD callback buffer" ));
229 # endif
230  // Issue read normally in this case.
231  DVDReadAsync( fileInfo, addr, length, offset, callback );
232  }
233  last_callback[cb] = callback;
234  last_callback_length[cb] = length;
235  last_callback_fileInfo[cb] = fileInfo;
236  last_callback_counter[cb] = 8;
237 
238  return TRUE;
239  }
240  else
241  {
242  // Shunt last reads down & fill in new one.
243  for ( int lp = 7; lp > 0; lp-- )
244  {
245  last_fileInfo[lp] = last_fileInfo[lp-1];
246  last_addr[lp] = last_addr[lp-1];
247  last_length[lp] = last_length[lp-1];
248  last_offset[lp] = last_offset[lp-1];
249  }
250  last_fileInfo[0] = fileInfo;
251  last_addr[0] = addr;
252  last_length[0] = length;
253  last_offset[0] = offset;
254 
255  return DVDReadAsync( fileInfo, addr, length, offset, callback );
256  }
257 }

571  // Figure which stream this is for.

593  // Possibly the result of a read in which we are no longer interested.
594  return;
595  }

612  gPcmStatus &= ~PCMSTATUS_STREAM_PLAYING( stream );

618  if( p_axvpb == NULL )

621  }
622 
623  // If this is the first chunk read for this voice, need to grab the voice and look at the header information.
624  if( gStreamInfo[stream].offset == 0 )
625  {
626  AXPBADDR addr;
627  AXPBADPCM adpcm;
628  AXPBVE ve;
629 
630  int enabled = OSDisableInterrupts();
631  // Grab pointer to header (first 96 byes of data).
632  sDSPADPCM* p_header = (sDSPADPCM*)( stream_mem_buffer[stream] );
633 
634  addr.format = AX_PB_FORMAT_ADPCM;
635 
636  // Depending on the number of bytes in the sound, we may not need to loop.
637  // Also depending on how many times we will be uploading to ARAM, we may want to start the stream
638  // halfway through the ARAM buffer, in order to ensure that we always write the last block to the upper half of ARAM
639  // (in order that we can safely set the end position).
640  int num_adpcm_bytes = p_header->num_adpcm_nibbles / 2;
641 
642  // Convert from byte to nibble address, and split into low and high words.
643  u32 start_address = ( stream_base[stream] * 2 ) + 2;
644  addr.currentAddressHi = (u16)( start_address >> 16 );
645  addr.currentAddressLo = (u16)( start_address & 0xFFFFU );
646 
647  if( num_adpcm_bytes <= 32768 )
648  {
649  // Stream fits in to ARAM buffer completely. No need to loop.
650  u32 end_address = ( stream_base[stream] * 2 ) + p_header->num_adpcm_nibbles - 1;
651 
652  addr.endAddressHi = (u16)( end_address >> 16 );
653  addr.endAddressLo = (u16)( end_address & 0xFFFFU );
654 
655  u32 zero_buffer_address = NxNgc::EngineGlobals.aram_zero * 2;
656  addr.loopAddressHi = (u16)( zero_buffer_address >> 16 );
657  addr.loopAddressLo = (u16)( zero_buffer_address & 0xFFFFU );
658 
659  addr.loopFlag = AXPBADDR_LOOP_OFF;
660 
661  gStreamInfo[stream].nextWrite = 1;
662 // OSReport( "Stream: %d is simple <= 32768 bytes\n", stream );
663  }
664  else
665  {
666  // Stream does not fit in to ARAM buffer completely. Needs to loop.
667  uint32 num_uploads = num_adpcm_bytes / STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE;
668  if(( num_adpcm_bytes % STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE ) > 0 )
669  ++num_uploads;
670  Dbg_Assert( num_uploads > 2 );
671 
672  addr.loopAddressHi = addr.currentAddressHi;
673  addr.loopAddressLo = addr.currentAddressLo;
674 
675  if( num_uploads & 0x01 )
676  {
677  // This is the tricky situation, where we start halfway through the ARAM buffer.
678  gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM += STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE;
679  start_address += ( STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE * 2 );
680  addr.currentAddressHi = (u16)( start_address >> 16 );
681  addr.currentAddressLo = (u16)( start_address & 0xFFFFU );
682  gStreamInfo[stream].nextWrite = 0;
683 // OSReport( "Stream: %d is complex tricky %d bytes\n", stream, num_adpcm_bytes );
684 
685  }
686  else
687  {
688  // This is the easy situation, where we start at the start of the ARAM buffer.
689  gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM = 0;
690  gStreamInfo[stream].nextWrite = 1;
691 // OSReport( "Stream: %d is complex non-tricky %d bytes\n", stream, num_adpcm_bytes );
692  }
693

695  addr.endAddressHi = (u16)( end_address >> 16 );
696  addr.endAddressLo = (u16)( end_address & 0xFFFFU );
697 
698  addr.loopFlag = AXPBADDR_LOOP_ON;
699  }
700 
701  memcpy( &adpcm.a[0][0], p_header->coef, sizeof( u16 ) * 16 );
702  adpcm.gain = p_header->gain;
703  adpcm.pred_scale = p_header->ps;
704  adpcm.yn1 = p_header->yn1;
705  adpcm.yn2 = p_header->yn2;
706

708  ve.currentDelta = 0;
709 
710  // Set voice parameters.
711  AXSetVoiceType( p_axvpb, AX_PB_TYPE_NORMAL ); // No loop context.
712  AXSetVoiceSrcType( p_axvpb, AX_PB_SRCSEL_LINEAR ); // Use linear interpolation.
713  AXSetVoiceVe( p_axvpb, &ve ); // Set overall volume.
714  AXSetVoiceAddr( p_axvpb, &addr ); // Input addressing.
715  AXSetVoiceAdpcm( p_axvpb, &adpcm ); // ADPCM coefficients.
716 
717 // p_axvpb->sync |= AX_SYNC_USER_ALLPARAMS;
718 // AXSetVoiceSrcRatio( p_axvpb, (48000.0f / ((float)AX_IN_SAMPLES_PER_SEC)) );
719 
720  // If this chunk is less than buffersize, zero out the excess bytes to prevent sound pop.
721  if( result < ( STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE + STREAM_BUFFER_HEADER_SIZE ))
722  {
723  memset( stream_mem_buffer[stream] + result, 0, ( STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE + STREAM_BUFFER_HEADER_SIZE ) - result );
724  DCFlushRange( stream_mem_buffer[stream] + result, ( STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE + STREAM_BUFFER_HEADER_SIZE ) - result );
725  }
726  OSRestoreInterrupts( enabled );
727 
728  // DMA this chunk up to ARAM, then use the ARQ callback to start the voice.
729  ARQPostRequest( &stream_arq_request[stream], // Address to user-allocated storage for an ARQTask data structure.
730  0, // User-enumerated identifier for the owner of the ARAM transaction.
731  ARQ_TYPE_MRAM_TO_ARAM, // Direction.
732  ARQ_PRIORITY_HIGH, // Priority.
733  (u32)( stream_mem_buffer[stream] + 96 ), // Source address.
734  stream_base[stream] + gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM, // Destination address.
735  STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE, // Transfer length (bytes). Must be multiple of 4.
736  &s_start_voice_callback ); // DMA complete callback function.
737 
738  gStreamInfo[stream].pitchAdjustmentForSamplingRate = ((float)p_header->sample_rate * 100.0f ) / 32000.0f;
739 
740  // Increment the ARAM offset and wrap when appropriate.
741  gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM += STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE;
742  if( gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM >= ( STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE * 2 ))
743  {
744  gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM -= ( STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE * 2 );
745  }
746 
747  // Increment the file pointer (remember we read the extra buffer bytes for the first read).
748  gStreamInfo[stream].offset += STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE + STREAM_BUFFER_HEADER_SIZE;
749  }
750  else
751  {
752  // If this chunk is less than buffersize, zero out the excess bytes to prevent sound pop.
753  if( result < STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE )
754  {
755  memset( stream_mem_buffer[stream] + result, 0, STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE - result );
756  DCFlushRange( stream_mem_buffer[stream] + result, STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE - result );
757  }
758 
759  // We want to DMA this chunk up to ARAM, but only if safe to do so, i.e. only when the playback position is in
760  // the opposite half of the ARAM buffer.
761  int current_aram_pos = ((uint32)( p_axvpb->pb.addr.currentAddressHi ) << 16 ) | (uint32)( p_axvpb->pb.addr.currentAddressLo );
762  bool safe_to_dma = false;
763

765  current_aram_pos = ( current_aram_pos - ( stream_base[stream] * 2 )) / 2;
766

768  {
769  // Safe to write to the second half of the ARAM buffer, if that is what needs updating.
770  if( gStreamInfo[stream].nextWrite == 1 )
771  {
772  safe_to_dma = true;
773 // OSReport( "Stream: %d ARAM: %d writing to second half\n", stream, current_aram_pos );
774  }
775  }
776  else
777  {
778  // Safe to write to the first half of the ARAM buffer, if that is what needs updating.
779  if( gStreamInfo[stream].nextWrite == 0 )
780  {
781  safe_to_dma = true;
782 // OSReport( "Stream: %d ARAM: %d writing to first half\n", stream, current_aram_pos );
783  }
784  }
785 
786  if( safe_to_dma )
787  {
788  // DMA this chunk up to ARAM.
789  ARQPostRequest( &stream_arq_request[stream], // Address to user-allocated storage for an ARQTask data structure.
790  0, // User-enumerated identifier for the owner of the ARAM transaction.
791  ARQ_TYPE_MRAM_TO_ARAM, // Direction.
792  ARQ_PRIORITY_HIGH, // Priority.
793  (u32)( stream_mem_buffer[stream] ), // Source address.
794  stream_base[stream] + gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM, // Destination address.
795  STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE, // Transfer length (bytes). Must be multiple of 4.
796  NULL ); // DMA complete callback function.
797 
798  // Increment the ARAM offset and wrap when appropriate.
799  gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM += STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE;
800  if( gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM >= ( STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE * 2 ))
801  {
802  gStreamInfo[stream].offsetInARAM -= ( STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE * 2 );
803  }
804 
805  // We have now processed another chunk.
806  gStreamInfo[stream].nextWrite = ( gStreamInfo[stream].nextWrite == 0 ) ? 1 : 0;
807 
808  // Increment the file pointer.
809  gStreamInfo[stream].offset += STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE;
810  }
811  else
812  {
813 // OSReport( "Stream: %d ARAM: %d discarding file buffer\n", stream, current_aram_pos );
814  }
815  }
816 
817  // If there is more data, kick off another read. NOTE this could potentially write over what we are about to DMA to ARAM.
818  int total_bytes_after_next_read = gStreamInfo[stream].offset + STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE;
819  int bytes_to_read;
820  if( total_bytes_after_next_read <= gStreamInfo[stream].fileSize )
821  {
822  bytes_to_read = STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE;
823  }
824  else
825  {
826  bytes_to_read = STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE - ( total_bytes_after_next_read - gStreamInfo[stream].fileSize );
827 
828  // Reduce bytes_to_read down to the next lowest multiple of 32.
829  bytes_to_read &= ~31;
830  }
831 
832  if( bytes_to_read > 0 )
833  {
834  _DVDReadAsync( &( gStreamInfo[stream].fileInfo[gStreamInfo[stream].currentFileInfo] ),
835  stream_mem_buffer[stream], // Base pointer of memory to read data into.
836  bytes_to_read, // Bytes to read.
837  gStreamInfo[stream].hedOffset + gStreamInfo[stream].offset, // Offset in file.
838  s_dvd_callback ); // Read complete callback.
839  }
840  else
841  {
842  // Here we may need to set the stop point for the voice, and switch from looping to non-looping.
843  if( p_axvpb->pb.addr.loopFlag == AXPBADDR_LOOP_ON )
844  {
845 // OSReport( "Stream: %d switching to loop off\n", stream );
846  p_axvpb->pb.addr.loopFlag = AXPBADDR_LOOP_OFF;
847  u32 zero_buffer_address = NxNgc::EngineGlobals.aram_zero * 2;
848  p_axvpb->pb.addr.loopAddressHi = (u16)( zero_buffer_address >> 16 );
849  p_axvpb->pb.addr.loopAddressLo = (u16)( zero_buffer_address & 0xFFFFU );
850  p_axvpb->sync |= ( AX_SYNC_USER_LOOP | AX_SYNC_USER_LOOPADDR );
851  }
852  }
853 }

Перекрестные ссылки _DVDReadAsync(), NxNgc::sEngineGlobals::aram_zero, Pcm::sDSPADPCM::coef, Pcm::FileStreamInfo::currentFileInfo, NxNgc::EngineGlobals, Pcm::FileStreamInfo::fileSize, Pcm::sDSPADPCM::format, Pcm::sDSPADPCM::gain, gPcmStatus, gStreamInfo, Pcm::FileStreamInfo::nextWrite, Pcm::sDSPADPCM::num_adpcm_nibbles, Pcm::FileStreamInfo::offset, Pcm::FileStreamInfo::offsetInARAM, Pcm::FileStreamInfo::p_voice, Pcm::FileStreamInfo::pitchAdjustmentForSamplingRate, Pcm::FileStreamInfo::preloadActive, Pcm::sDSPADPCM::ps, s_start_voice_callback(), Pcm::sDSPADPCM::sample_rate, stream_arq_request, stream_base, stream_mem_buffer, Pcm::sDSPADPCM::yn1 и Pcm::sDSPADPCM::yn2.

◆ myAlloc()

static void* Pcm::myAlloc ( u32  size)
static

Memory allocation callback.

The player calls this function for all its memory needs. In this example an OSAlloc() is all we need to do.

Заметки
The returned memory address MUST be aligned on a 32 byte boundary. Otherwise, the player will fail!
Аргументы
sizeNumber of bytes to allocate
Возвращает
Ptr to allocated memory (aligned to 32 byte boundary)

1544  offset = ( offset / 2 ) - stream_base[i];
1545 // OSReport( "stream %d offset is at: %d\n", i, offset );
1546 
1547  if( offset > gStreamInfo[i].offsetInARAM )
1548  {
1549 // OSReport( "play point beyond byuffer...\n" );
1550  }
1551 
1552  // Flag this stream as playing.
1553  gPcmStatus |= PCMSTATUS_STREAM_PLAYING( i );
1554  check = true;
1555  }
1556  }
1557  }
1558  // Deal with disk errors.
1559  if ( gPcmStatus & PCMSTATUS_MUSIC_PLAYING ) check = true;
1560  if ( check ) DVDCheckAsync();
1561  return 0;
1562 }

1979  "VC/VC_02_Female",

1981  };
1982

1985

1987  {

1989  if( p_name )
1990  {
1991  uint32 name_checksum = Crc::GenerateCRCFromString( p_name + 1 );
1992  if( checksum == name_checksum )
1993  {
1994  // Got a match - hook up filename here....
1995  sprintf( sPreLoadMusicFilename, "music/vag/cutscenes/%s", p_filename[lp] );
1996  return PCMAudio_PlayMusicTrack( sPreLoadMusicFilename, true );
1997  }
1998  }
1999  }
2000  sPreLoadMusicFilename[0] = 0;
2001  return false;
2002 }
